message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
public void writer() throws Exception {
    PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter("words.txt");
    for(String word : webster) {
        out.write(word + "\n");
    }
    out.close();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The ConcurrentModificationException occurs when you are trying to modify a collection while iterating over it. In your case, you are trying to write the elements of the collection to a file while iterating over it. The solution is to use a for-each loop instead of an iterator. This way, you are not modifying the collection while iterating over it. The PrintWriter.write() method is used to write the string representation of the object to the output stream. The "\n" is used to add a new line after each word.
